result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel Erazo Santa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Shall serve 60 days DCJ consecutive to any sentences currently imposed
Consecutive to: Shall serve jail sentence within the confines of the Wisconsin Prison System

The DOC shall deduct restitution and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income at a rate of 40% of the Defendant's income.
Shall provide DNA sample.

2:31 PM (22CF06/22CF75/22TR105/22TR106) Defendant Angel Erazo Santa in court, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler in court for Angel Erazo Santa.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty George-Stifler appears on cases 22CF06 and 22CF75 only. Victims rights compliance has been met; Court reviews plea agreement, rights, charges, and penalties. As to case 22CF06, count #2, def enters a plea of no contest, case 22CF06 count #3, def enters a plea of guilty. As to case 22CF75, count #1, def enters a plea of guilty. Court makes findings; Court accepts pleas in 22CF06, counts #2 and #3 and case 22CF75, count #1 and finds def guilty. Case 22CF06 counts #1 and #4 are DRI. Case 22CF75, count #2 is DRI. Sentencing arguments heard; def makes statement. Cases 22TR105 and 22TR106 are dismissed. Court heard.

Court imposes the following sentence (case 22CF06):
As to count #2:
60 days DCJ, consecutive to any other sentence previously imposed
As to count #3:
120 days DCJ, consecutive to any other sentence previously imposed
Court costs
DNA + costs
*Presentence credit of 2 days

Court imposes the following sentence (case 22CF75):
12 months IC
24 months ES
*consecutive to any other sentence
Court costs
DNA + costs
*Presentence credit of 1 day

Transport
and Stipulation for Cont. of STC
and Stipulation for Cont. of STC

Transport

09:12 AM Defendant Angel Erazo Santa in court with attorney Alyssa F. George.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Acknowledgement by Person Posting Bail/Deposit

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:46 PM Defendant Angel Erazo Santa in custody via video with attorney Katherine Marie Findley in person (will appoint); Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angel Erazo Santa appeared by video means; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $1,000 Cash bond; Atty. Findley response; Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 1/13/22 at 8:30am in Br. 1; Court sets $1,000.00 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
